Cheese Stats
===================================

Column
-------------------------------------
    
Here are some charts about cheese. It's important to study cheese becasue it is interesting. It is interesting because we love cheese.    



### Chart 1
```{r, fig.width = 14, fig.height = 10}
cheeses <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2024/2024-06-04/cheeses.csv')

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = cheeses) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = milk)) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 14)) +
  labs(x = "Milk", y = "Number of Cheeses")
```
